member.name: T:alexbegh.Utility.Helpers.Atomic.AtomicMutable`1
member.summary: This class provides light-weight fast access to its members by multiple threads which may be spread across multiple cores. Performs a lot faster than using lock on its members. A concrete class needs to derive from it.

member.name: F:alexbegh.Utility.Helpers.Atomic.AtomicMutable`1._totalChanges
member.summary: The global change counter (not thread specific)

member.name: M:alexbegh.Utility.Helpers.Atomic.AtomicMutable`1.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance, initializing the data member

member.name: M:alexbegh.Utility.Helpers.Atomic.AtomicMutable`1.AcquireRead
member.summary: Acquire a read lock. Increments the read counter, waits until the write counter drops to zero

member.name: M:alexbegh.Utility.Helpers.Atomic.AtomicMutable`1.AcquireWrite
member.summary: Acquire a write lock. Sets the write counter to 1 as soon as it is 0, then waits until the read counter is 0

member.name: M:alexbegh.Utility.Helpers.Atomic.AtomicMutable`1.ReleaseWrite
member.summary: Releases a write lock, increments the thread specific change counter

member.name: M:alexbegh.Utility.Helpers.Atomic.AtomicMutable`1.GetAndReset(`0@)
member.summary: Gets the contained data, resets the thread specific change counter

member.name: M:alexbegh.Utility.Helpers.Atomic.AtomicMutable`1.Reset
member.summary: Resets the thread specific change info,

member.name: M:alexbegh.Utility.Helpers.Atomic.AtomicMutable`1.Set(`0@)
member.summary: Sets the contained data, implicitly increments the thread specific change counter

member.name: M:alexbegh.Utility.Helpers.Atomic.AtomicMutable`1.HasChangedSinceLastGetForCurrentThread
member.summary: Checks if the given data has changed from the view of a certain thread,
member.returns: true if changes are available since last GetAndReset

summary.para: This class helps implementing the INotifyPropertyChanged interface.

list.item: Can be fed with dependent properties; when one property changes, the dependent properties' fire also (,
Automatically checks for changed values in a generic Set method ()
Provides a method which considers the dependent properties and derives the caller properties' name automatically

member.name: M:alexbegh.Utility.Helpers.NotifyPropertyChanged.NotifyPropertyChangedImpl.#ctor(System.Type)
member.summary: Constructs the object; remembers the callers' type for looking up dependent properties efficiently

member.name: P:alexbegh.Utility.Helpers.NotifyPropertyChanged.NotifyPropertyChangedImpl.DependentProperties
member.summary: The dependent property dictionary (type -> propertyName -> dependent properties)

member.name: P:alexbegh.Utility.Helpers.NotifyPropertyChanged.NotifyPropertyChangedImpl.SuppressNotificationsCounter
member.summary: If >0, INotifyPropertyChanged events are being suppressed

member.summary: Checks if the given list of property names are valid in the given type
member.returns: true if all properties exist and are public

member.summary: Add dependent properties for a given source property

member.summary: Add a group of interdependent properties (i.e. if one of them changes, all of them change)

member.summary: Method to set a backing field if the new value is different
member.param: The name of the wrapping property

member.summary: Method to set a backing field if the new value is different; fires a given action on change also
member.param: The action to fire if the field changed its value
The name of the wrapping property

member.summary: Fires the property changed event; derives the callers' property name automatically and takes care of firing the events for dependent properties as well

member.summary: Extension methods for the interface INotifyPropertyChanged

member.name: T:alexbegh.Utility.Helpers.ViewModel.BaseViewModel
member.summary: This class acts as a base class for ViewModels. Features: * Manages a list of child viewmodels * Propagates "Save" method to all of its children * Collects exceptions happening during saving of the children, returns them as an AggregateException

member.name: T:alexbegh.Utility.Managers.Background.BackgroundTaskManager
member.summary: The BackgroundTaskManager class provides the following features: - Serves as a task pool with a given key - Only one task with a certain key will run simultaneously - Keeps progress indicators in the UI up to date (see LoadingProgressControl)

member.summary: The monitor task which updates the calling UI threads with the collected progress information once per 100msec

member.summary: The locker for accessing the "Tasks" property

member.summary: The locker for starting a new task

member.summary: Queue of items to post to the main process

member.summary: The list of discardable task keys

member.summary: True if cancel dialog is already running

member.name: M:alexbegh.Utility.Managers.Background.BackgroundTaskManager.RegisterDiscardable(System.String)
member.summary: Registers the provided task given its key as discardable, which means the "Cancel" operation will succeed without waiting for completion. This relies on the task not firing any events after having received a OperationCancelledException!

member.name: M:alexbegh.Utility.Managers.Background.BackgroundTaskManager.Cancel(System.String)
member.summary: Cancels a running background task. Does nothing if the given task doesn't run anymore. Performs synchronously.

member.summary: Starts a new task; cancels an already running task with the same key, if any
member.param: true if a running task should be cancelled, false if the LoadingProgressViewModel should attach to the running task

member.name: T:alexbegh.Utility.UserControls.FieldMapperGrid.FieldExposer`1
member.summary: This class exposes the access to a given field using an indexer implementation. It is used by the FieldMapperGridViewModel to wrap the contained outer type to a ViewModel compatible type.

member.name: M:alexbegh.Utility.UserControls.FieldMapperGrid.FieldExposer`1.TryGetMember(System.Dynamic.GetMemberBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary:
Summary: Provides the implementation for operations that get member values. Classes derived from the System.Dynamic.DynamicObject class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as getting a value for a property.
Parameters: binder: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member on which the dynamic operation is performed. For example, for the Console.WriteLine(sampleObject.SampleProperty) statement, where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the System.Dynamic.DynamicObject class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
result: The result of the get operation. For example, if the method is called for a property, you can assign the property value to result.
Returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a run-time exception is thrown.)

member.name: M:alexbegh.Utility.UserControls.FieldMapperGrid.FieldExposer`1.TrySetMember(System.Dynamic.SetMemberBinder,System.Object)
member.summary:
Summary: Provides the implementation for operations that set member values. Classes derived from the System.Dynamic.DynamicObject class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as setting a value for a property.
Parameters: binder: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member to which the value is being assigned. For example, for the statement sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the System.Dynamic.DynamicObject class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
value: The value to set to the member. For example, for sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the System.Dynamic.DynamicObject class, the value is "Test".
Returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)
